title: General Knowledge Quiz VII (50 Questions)
description: Challenging but fair. New categories: Sports & Games, Food & Drink, Business & Economics, Medicine & Human Body, Space & Astronomy.

items.q: Which nation won the first FIFA World Cup in 1930?
items.a: Uruguay - hosts and inaugural champions

items.q: How many squares are on a standard chessboard?
items.a: 64 - arranged in an 8×8 grid of alternating colors

items.q: In tennis, how many Grand Slam tournaments are there each year?
items.a: Four - Australian Open, Roland Garros, Wimbledon, US Open

items.q: What is the term for three strikes in a row in ten‑pin bowling?
items.a: Turkey - bowling slang for a triple strike

items.q: In cricket, what is the traditional maximum length of a Test match?
items.a: Five days - with up to 90 overs scheduled per day

items.q: Which piece combines the moves of the rook and bishop in chess?
items.a: The queen - moves any number of squares straight or diagonally

items.q: Which country hosts the Tour de France cycling race?
items.a: France - multi‑stage race established in 1903

items.q: In association football, what is the maximum number of players per side on the field?
items.a: 11 - including the goalkeeper

items.q: What is the only Olympic sport where competitors can legally deliver a punch?
items.a: Boxing - governed by weight classes and protective gear

items.q: In rugby union, how many points is a try worth (modern scoring)?
items.a: Five - plus potential two‑point conversion on the kick

items.q: What protected name is reserved for sparkling wine from a specific French region?
items.a: Champagne - must come from Champagne and follow AOC rules

items.q: Which spice comes from the dried stigmas of Crocus sativus?
items.a: Saffron - prized threads used for flavor and color

items.q: In Japanese cuisine, what is sushi rice seasoned with?
items.a: Rice vinegar (with sugar and salt) - gives sushi its tang and texture

items.q: Chocolate is made from the seeds of which plant?
items.a: The cacao tree (Theobroma cacao) - fermented and roasted beans

items.q: What culinary scale measures the heat of chili peppers?
items.a: The Scoville scale - based on capsaicin concentration

items.q: What Italian cheese is traditionally aged in brine and has a DOC status from Parma?
items.a: Parmigiano‑Reggiano - hard grana cheese often grated

items.q: Which sauce is an emulsion of oil and egg yolk, often used on sandwiches?
items.a: Mayonnaise - classic cold emulsion

items.q: What is the main ingredient in hummus besides tahini and lemon?
items.a: Chickpeas - blended to a creamy spread

items.q: Which beverage’s name literally means 'baked tea' in Chinese?
items.a: Pu‑erh - fermented, aged tea traditionally pressed into cakes

items.q: Which country is the origin of the flatbread 'injera'?
items.a: Ethiopia - spongy sourdough made from teff flour

items.q: Who wrote The Wealth of Nations (1776)?
items.a: Adam Smith - foundational work of classical economics

items.q: What does GDP stand for in economics?
items.a: Gross Domestic Product - total value of goods and services produced

items.q: What market name is an acronym for National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations?
items.a: NASDAQ - major U.S. electronic stock exchange

items.q: What index is widely used to track consumer inflation in the U.S.?
items.a: CPI (Consumer Price Index) - measures price changes in a market basket

items.q: Which 1944 conference created the IMF and what became the World Bank?
items.a: Bretton Woods - established the IMF and IBRD institutions

items.q: What term describes a sustained decline in general price levels?
items.a: Deflation - the opposite of inflation

items.q: What do we call a market dominated by a single seller?
items.a: Monopoly - can restrict output and raise prices

items.q: Which ratio is current assets divided by current liabilities?
items.a: Current ratio - a basic liquidity measure

items.q: What do economists call the cost of the next best forgone alternative?
items.a: Opportunity cost - core concept in decision‑making

items.q: Which U.S. stock index tracks 30 large industrial companies?
items.a: The Dow Jones Industrial Average - price‑weighted index

items.q: Which hormone produced by pancreatic beta cells lowers blood glucose?
items.a: Insulin - secreted by islets of Langerhans in the pancreas

items.q: Where does most blood cell formation occur in adults?
items.a: Bone marrow - site of hematopoiesis for red and many white cells

items.q: What is the largest organ of the human body by surface area?
items.a: The skin - protective barrier and thermoregulator

items.q: Which bone is the longest and strongest in the human body?
items.a: The femur - thighbone forming the hip and knee joints

items.q: Which virus causes the disease COVID‑19?
items.a: SARS‑CoV‑2 - a coronavirus identified in late 2019

items.q: What is the medical term for high blood pressure?
items.a: Hypertension - chronic elevation of arterial pressure

items.q: Which vitamin is crucial for calcium absorption and bone health?
items.a: Vitamin D - synthesized in skin with sunlight exposure

items.q: What is the term for the body’s ability to maintain internal stability?
items.a: Homeostasis - dynamic equilibrium across systems

items.q: Which blood type is known as the universal donor for red cells?
items.a: O negative - lacks A, B, and Rh antigens

items.q: Which iron‑containing protein carries oxygen in red blood cells?
items.a: Hemoglobin - binds oxygen in the lungs and releases it in tissues

items.q: What is the nearest major galaxy to the Milky Way?
items.a: Andromeda (M31) - about 2.5 million light‑years away

items.q: What space telescope was deployed by STS‑31 in April 1990?
items.a: The Hubble Space Telescope - launched aboard Space Shuttle Discovery

items.q: Which planet has the most extensive ring system?
items.a: Saturn - rings composed largely of ice particles and dust

items.q: What is a light‑year a measure of?
items.a: Distance - the span light travels in one year

items.q: Which dwarf planet lies in the asteroid belt?
items.a: Ceres - first discovered in 1801 by Giuseppe Piazzi

items.q: What are the two main types of star clusters?
items.a: Open and globular clusters - loosely bound vs dense spherical groups

items.q: What term describes a star’s explosive death that outshines its host galaxy?
items.a: Supernova - can seed space with heavier elements

items.q: Which NASA rover landed on Mars in 2021?
items.a: Perseverance - mission includes the Ingenuity helicopter

items.q: What is the boundary around a black hole from which nothing can escape?
items.a: Event horizon - where escape velocity exceeds light speed

items.q: What is the name of the galaxy cluster that includes the Milky Way?
items.a: The Local Group - small cluster containing dozens of galaxies
